snippet.title: Knife-wielding man shot by police in northern NSW
snippet.content: A man has been airlifted to hospital in a critical condition after being shot by police during a confrontation in Grafton on Sunday afternoon. The man, who is yet to be identified, allegedly confronted police wielding a knife after they responded to reports of a disturbance at a unit on Turf Street. Photo: Rob Gunstone Police first Tasered the man, before shooting him. Officers treated the man at the scene until paramedics arrived. The man was then taken to Grafton Hospital before being airlifted to hospital on the Gold Coast. A police statement said a critical incident team would investigate the circumstances of the shooting, which will be subject to an independent review. Police are appealing for witnesses to come forward and call Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
